title: @Meddler What happened to RiotGMang's Gangplank rework?
body:
We got the R change a while back but nothing else and were told that the rework would be relatively soon after that, and still no word on it.

Gangplank has a non interactive kit that is honestly somewhat boring. His W and E take no skill and are just use and forget. His kit is somewhat clunky because of cast animations but removing those would make him obscene at higher level play if you played him perfectly. His Q is just crazy safe farming and RNG burst and his R is only ever used to get a free assist while in Top Lane. 

For a Ship Captain and Pirate Marauder he really doesn't do anything flashy or cool or exciting. I really wish we had Kunkka over him. http://dota2.gamepedia.com/Kunkka

replies.body: Still planned and the gameplay changes are showing promise. Won't be for quite a while though, there'll be a number of other reworks first.

Just curious; what sort of pacing can we expect for these reworks? One every month? Every 3 months? 6?

Mostly I'm wondering if it's worth getting my hopes up for a rework yet. As I understand it, Poppy is the next large-scale project, and *might* be released by the end of the year. But will there be one or two smaller reworks put out before then?

At any point in time we'll have multiple reworks underway. Some of those will be really large scale like Poppy (Sion level of work/change). Most will be smaller, ranging in size from fairly small adjustments like Viktor to moderate sized ones like Heimer. 

For this year that means you'll almost certainly see multiple other gameplay reworks before Poppy this year. Expectation is that she'll be the next really big one though.
